content:
Was trying to troubleshoot some authentication issues... I can't tell what is disabled or enabled because this is what I see:
image.png
@Tyson Parker checked is enabled, unchecked is disabled; I think that black box is the browser indicating its keyboard focus (i.e. what input element will be modified if you hit space, for example).
I think it's pretty easy to see if that you've seen the checkmarks.
That said, I wonder if we'd be better off deleting whatever CSS is choosing the focus outline there.

Window 10: In Firefox I can see checkboxes, in Chrome, no checkboxes are visible. I disabled a extensions and same result.
I went into the settings on this Zulip org and I can see checkboxes in the preferences. Not on my own org though?

No one else has this issue?
I'd appreciate folks on windows trying to reproduce.
I cannot reproduce (Chrome 95.0.4638.69 and Firefox 94.0.1 on Windows 10 21H1 19043.1288; night, day, or automatic color schemes).
I suspect the page failed to load correctly. What if you reload it?
If that doesnâ€™t work, open the developer tools, go to the Console tab, and see if there are any errors related to loading checkbox.5cc8e6c419aa3d443e73.svg.
